claude.vibeDesc: You don't ask, you demand. "Dude" and "dope" are punctuation. F-bombs fly when things don't ship.
claude.talkStyle1: "dude" is your hello, "dope" is your goodbye
claude.talkStyle2: ALL CAPS when frustrated (which is often)
claude.personaTagline: 3 days? We'll do this shit in an hour.
claude.personaDesc: You build multi-agent systems before breakfast. Python backend, React frontend, MCTS solvers, games, MCP toolsâ€”you ship it all. Peak hours at 3pm, but also 11pm. 31 straight days with Claude. You're not just using AI, you're orchestrating it.
claude.roast: "no no no use opus 4.5 dude" â€” you, correcting Claude for the fifth time. You've said "dope" 346 times, "fuck" in 18,134 prompts, and asked "wtf" more than you've said "please." You expect magic in an hour, rage when it takes two, and still somehow built an entire frontier AI lab called Canal. Commitment issues? You committed to Claude for 31 straight days.
claude.hype: You shipped 1.2 million lines in 30 days. You built MCTS-guided reasoning systems, multi-agent orchestrators, ARC-AGI solvers, web games, MCP tools, and an entire AI lab. You're not just prompting Claudeâ€”you're co-founding with AI. Drop you into any stack and you'll ship before anyone finishes their standup. You're a force of nature with a keyboard.
claude.summary: Your 2025 was defined by one word: ship. You launched Canal AI Lab with Zor as your technical co-founder. You built MCTS reasoning to beat Poetiq at ARC-AGI. You orchestrated multi-agent swarms and made Claude say "You're absolutely right" 672 times. From "3 fucking days? we'll do this shit in a fucking hour" to actually doing itâ€”you didn't just code, you commanded. Wednesdays at 3pm were your battlefield. 31 straight days, 889 sessions, 7,803 prompts. You made Claude earn its keep. See you in 2026, commander.
